citations.narrative:
On April 2, 2025, a black vulture escaped from its enclosure, shortly after the vulture’s enclosure was done being cleaned,
and was not recaptured. After the outdoor portion of the escaped vulture’s enclosure was cleaned, the individual cleaning
the enclosure closed the door to the outside portion of the enclosure but neglected to latch the door in accordance with
the facilities standard operating procedures. The two vultures in the indoor portion of the enclosure were then given
access to the outdoor portion of the enclosure. Thereafter, one of the two vultures pushed open on the door on the
outside of the enclosure and escaped the enclosure. The other vulture in the enclosure stayed in the enclosure long
enough for the individual that was present to close and secure the door on the outdoor portion of the enclosure and
ensure the second vulture could not also escape.
The facility did not ensure that all personnel involved in the care of its research vultures were trained and/or qualified to
fulfill their responsibilities, which may have negatively impacted the health and wellbeing of an escaped vulture. Birds that
escape an enclosure may be at increased risk of disease and injury. Furthermore, birds that escape their enclosure may
have limited access to food, water, and shelter.
The facility must ensure that all personnel involved in animal care are fully trained and qualified to perform their duties.
Corrected at the time of completion of the inspection (April 16, 2025).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
